title: Overview
description: A high-level introduction to the Super-linter API, covering its purpose, key features, and target use cases for developers and DevOps teams.

title: Getting Started
description: A concise, step-by-step guide to running the API with Docker and making your first linting request to verify the setup.

title: Guides
description: Practical tutorials and integration examples to solve common use cases, from linting a full project to CI/CD integration.

title: Lint a Full Project
description: Learn how to lint an entire local project by packaging it as a tar.gz archive and submitting it via a base64-encoded request.

title: Integrate with CI/CD
description: Step-by-step instructions and examples for integrating the Super-linter API into a CI/CD pipeline, featuring a complete GitHub Actions workflow.

title: Using SDK Examples
description: Code examples demonstrating how to interact with the API using client libraries in popular languages like Node.js and Python.

title: Core Concepts
description: In-depth explanations of the fundamental components and architecture of the API, such as the linting process, job management, and caching.

title: Linting Execution
description: An explanation of the lifecycle of a linting request, including workspace creation, linter process execution, and output parsing.

title: Asynchronous Jobs
description: Details on how the asynchronous job system works, covering job submission, status tracking, cancellation, and processing.

title: Caching Layer
description: A look into the caching mechanism, explaining how content and option hashes are generated to optimize performance for repeated requests.

title: API Reference
description: A complete technical reference for every API endpoint, including parameters, request bodies, response formats, and error codes.

title: Endpoints
description: A comprehensive list of all available API endpoints, detailing their methods, URL parameters, request bodies, and functionality.

title: Data Types
description: Reference for all data structures used in API requests and responses, such as LinterOptions, LinterResult, and JobStatus objects.

title: Error Codes
description: A dictionary of all possible error codes, their meanings, and the HTTP status they correspond to, ensuring robust error handling.

title: Operations
description: Guides for deploying, managing, and monitoring the Super-linter API in a production environment.

title: Deployment
description: Instructions for deploying the service using Docker, Docker Compose, and Kubernetes, including persistent storage configuration.

title: Configuration
description: A guide to all available environment variables for configuring aspects like rate limiting, logging, and workspace paths.

title: Monitoring
description: How to use the /health and /metrics endpoints for monitoring the API's health, performance, and usage statistics.

title: Supported Linters
description: A detailed reference of all supported linters, including their versions, supported file types, and performance characteristics.
